Module com.example.breakout_clone
Package com.example.breakout_clone.model.game

Class GameModel

java.lang.Object
com.example.breakout_clone.model.game.GameModel
public class GameModel extends Object
The Singleton class that represents the model for the Game MVC. It holds all the data related to the game and provides the controllers methods to update the data based on some events.
This class has been developed from the GameFrame and the Wall class
Author:
Praket Chavan - modified
See Also:
GameController, GameEndController, PauseMenuController, DebugController

    Sets the Pause property to the new boolean value that is passed
    If the new value is true then the message property is set to the "Game Paused" value
    Otherwise the message property is set to be an empty String

    Sets the game score to the new value that is passed

    Method is called when the space key pressed.

    Sets the pause value to be true and stops the GameTimer

    updateBrickCount()

    • setPause

      private void setPause​(boolean pause)
      Sets the Pause property to the new boolean value that is passed
      If the new value is true then the message property is set to the "Game Paused" value
      Otherwise the message property is set to be an empty String
      Parameters:
      pause - the new pause value to be set
      See Also:
      isPause(), pauseProperty(), setMessage(String)

    • restart

      private void restart()
      Sets all the property values to their default values. This method essentially restarts the gameModel object

    • createPowerUp

      public void createPowerUp​(PowerUp power)
      Add power up object that is passed to the power ups observable list and the impact handlers observable list
      Parameters:
      power - the new PowerUp object that needs to be added

    • hasNextLevel

      public boolean hasNextLevel()
      Checks to see if there is any more levels left to be played
      Returns:
      false if the Level Queue is not empty else true

    • leftKeyPressed

      public void leftKeyPressed()
      Method is called when the left arrow key is pressed. Calls the PaddleController.moveLeft() method

    • rightKeyPressed

      public void rightKeyPressed()
      Method is called when the right arrow key is pressed. Calls the PaddleController.moveRight() method

    • spaceKeyPressed

      public void spaceKeyPressed()
      Method is called when the space key pressed. If the pause property is true then it starts the gameTimer else stops it.

    • escapeKeyPressed

      public void escapeKeyPressed()
      Stops the game timer

    • f1KeyPressed

      public void f1KeyPressed​(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent event)
      Stops the game timer
      Parameters:
      event -

    • startTimer

      private void startTimer()
      Sets the pause value to be false and starts the gameTimer

    • stopTimer

      public void stopTimer()
      Sets the pause value to be true and stops the GameTimer

    • onFocusGain

      public void onFocusGain()
      Method is called when the game gains focus. Sets the focus property to be false and starts the gameTimer
      See Also:
      startTimer(), setFocus(boolean)

    • onFocusLost

      public void onFocusLost()
      Method is called when the game gains focus. Sets the focus property to be true and stops the gameTimer
      See Also:
      startTimer(), setFocus(boolean)

    • gameReset

      public void gameReset()
      Resets the game when a life is lost or a level has been completed
      Calls the reset method of the Paddle Controller and the ball Controller.
      Also stops the gameTimer and sets the pause property to be true
      See Also:
      BallController, PaddleController

    • levelNumberProperty

      private javafx.beans.property.SimpleIntegerProperty levelNumberProperty()
      Gets the level number IntegerProperty
      See Also:
      getLevelNumber()

    • nextLevel

      public void nextLevel()
      Clear the list of bricks and power ups.
      Gets the next available level and sets the bricks observable list to the new levels brick array.
      Increments the level number counter

    • setBallXSpeed

      public void setBallXSpeed​(double xSpeed)
      Sets the ball X speed to the passed value by calling the BallController.setXSpeed(double) method
      Parameters:
      xSpeed - the new X speed of the ball

    • setBallYSpeed

      public void setBallYSpeed​(double ySpeed)
      Sets the ball Y speed to the passed value by calling the BallController.setXSpeed(double) method
      Parameters:
      ySpeed - the new Y speed of the ball

    • onContinueClick

      public void onContinueClick()
      Removes the blur effect from the game screen and starts the gameTimer

    • onExitClick

      public void onExitClick()
      Exits the program

    • onRestartClick

      public void onRestartClick()
      Stops the timer and restarts the game by calling the restart() method

    • islevelComplete

      public boolean islevelComplete()
      Checks to see if the level has been completed
      Returns:
      true if there is no brick remaining else false

    • move

      public void move()
      Calls the move method of all the ball, player and power up object

    • onBallLost

      public void onBallLost()
      Sets the message property to "Ball Lost" and decreases the remaining lives

    • updateBrickCount

      public void updateBrickCount()
      Updates the brick counter by counting the remaining bricks that are not unbreakable

    • addScore

      public void addScore​(int num)
      Add the num value to the score property
      Parameters:
      num - the amount of points to add

    • clearLevel

      public void clearLevel()
      Remove all the bricks from the list

    • addLife

      public void addLife()
      Add an extra life for the player

    • createBall

      private void createBall()
      Create a new Ball object and set it speed to the Ball initial speed

    • createLevel

      private void createLevel​(int level, int difficulty)
      Creates level objects using the level Factory
      Parameters:
      level - the level number that is to be created
      See Also:
      LevelFactory

    • createPlayer

      private Paddle createPlayer()
      Creates a new Paddle object and add it to the impact handler
      Returns:
      the new Paddle object
